content: I think it's spurious because the only PR making changes in rustdoc is https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/90412
and as you can see, it'd be surprising to have such a negative impact...
likewise, PR #90422 has a lot of regression to doc generation
For this one we expected it and the discussion is already started: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/90183

GuillaumeGomez said:

I think it's spurious because the only PR making changes in rustdoc is https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/90412

hmm is #90374 not relevant? I was only looking at titles and thought it mentioned doc
oh I see, that doesn’t change rustdoc code itself, just the docs for rustdoc
Look at the 11 lines of diff, I updated an error message ;)
so I really think it's spurious. However for https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/90183 it was expected but like I said, I'm working on still reducing it
I'm on something else currently but will come back to it as soon as possible
Okay. I’m curious how spurious it is: Does it persist in the successive builds? I will look.
Left some analysis on the issue you opened.
